comments:
We created a metadata xml file for a new JSF taglib and contributed it to the standardMetaDataFiles extension point.  We accidentally left the file out of the binary build of our plugin though and I noticed the exception below showing up in the error log as a result.  I don't know if this has any other detrimental effects on the framework but it would be good to add a check for file existence or otherwise avoid/catch exception during registry loading.


java.io.FileNotFoundException: Metadata file not found:  [path to the xml file]

Fixed.

The exception was being caught.  The issue here is that the stack trace was being added to the log which it should not have.

traces.message: Metadata file not found:  [path to the xml file]
